title: Drawing, "Nature Studies, probably from Colombia: Monkey, Parasites and Trees", 1853
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, at upper left: 2 / 2 Parasites; again, at upper right:  Beautiful light yellowish / green resembles at a distance the / willow almost exactly excepting / that the green is deeper; again, at center left: 2 's  / tree / 2 white / flower / clusters; again at lower left: monkey; and again, at lower right: Tree foliage so dense / that no trunk or / branches could / be seen.
description: Horizontal view containing a tree top, at upper left; branches, at  upper center; trees at a river bank, at upper right; trees, at left center; tree tops and plants on the edge of water, at center right; monkey walking upon a branch and tree tops, at lower left.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Nature Studies, probably from Colombia: Monkey, Parasites and Trees", 1853.
1853. Graphite on light gray paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-136.
